results.title: Fibrous plaster in Australia
results.creator_credit: John Kenyon, M K and M Pictures and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the mining of gypsum in South Australia, calcining for plaster, harvesting of sisal in eastern Africa for fibre, manufacture of fibrous plaster sheets and forms, and their fixing and joining in modern building construction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Kenyon, M K and M Pictures and Gateway Film Productions

results.title: Fiberglass = Fibreglass
results.creator_credit: Joe Hayward, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Helmut Engelhardt
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the versatility of fibreglass, showing preparation of a single mould, lamination, removal of the mould and finishing. Also shows the method of repairing an object made of fibreglass.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joe Hayward, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Helmut Engelhardt

results.title: Fiber in art = Fibre in art
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Paul Burnford Film Productions
results.brief_description: Part of the “Materials in art” series. Shows the use of fibre in knotting, stitchery and weaving using a variety of simple looms. Demonstrates an array of techniques that can be used in the classroom. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Burnford and Paul Burnford Film Productions

results.title: FI11 Pilots first flight
results.brief_description: Pilots and navigators trained to fly F111 aircraft, spend weeks mastering the process in a flight simulator and learning about the planes before becoming proficient enough to fly the F111 fighter jets. Trainee pilots become skilled in the performance of the F111 whilst the navigator trainees study the radar and navigation systems of the aircraft. This program documents the training process which results in the pilots and navigators first flight in the F111 jets.

results.title: Fete a Coutances
results.creator_credit: Antony Barrier and Mary Glasgow Audio-Visual
results.brief_description: Describes the life of farmers and villagers in and around Coutances in Normandy. The documentary includes clips of conversations between inhabitants of Coutances, scenes of a wedding and of the 14th July clebrations. In French language.

results.title: Festival time
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and V.R. Sarma
results.brief_description: The festivals, mostly of religious origin, celebrated each year in India including: Holi, the spring festival, marked by fights with colored water, open air performances of the Vedas, and dancing; Gokul Ashtam which celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna; Ganesh, devoted to the god of wisdom; Dusserah, the autumn harvest festival when womanhood is venerated, books and tools of trade are worshipped in thanks for a livelihood and demon effigies are set on fire; Divala, festival of the goddess of wealth, a festival of lights and a special occasion for the trading community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and V.R. Sarma
results.description: The festivals, mostly of religious origin, celebrated each year in India including: Holi, the spring festival, marked by fights with colored water, open air performances of the Vedas, and dancing; Gokul Ashtam which celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna; Ganesh, devoted to the god of wisdom; Dusserah, the autumn harvest festival when womanhood is venerated, books and tools of trade are worshipped in thanks for a livelihood and demon effigies are set on fire; Divala, festival of the goddess of wealth, a festival of lights and a special occasion for the trading community.

results.title: Festival of kites
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the City of Darebin, this short video documents the Festival of Kites, organized by the North Eastern Melbourne Chinese Association and by the Australian Kite Association. An all-day event held in parklands in Preston, this multicultural event includes performances by comedians, Indian dancers and a Chinese Choir.

results.title: Festival in Edinburgh
results.creator_credit: Howard Thomas, Associated British-Pathe and Douglas Clarke
results.brief_description: Scenes from the 1954 Edinburgh Festival of music and drama, including a short sequence showing Margot Fonteyn and Michael Somes dancing ‘The Firebird’, Ann Todd and Paul Rogers in a scene from Macbeth, Sir Adrian Boult conducting the National Youth Orchestra and before the castle.
